intro: Spergularia microsperma, commonly known as the small-spored sandflower, is a flowering plant native to arid and coastal regions. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its small, pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are often succulent, helping it retain moisture in dry climates. Spergularia microsperma plays a role in stabilizing dunes and is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects.
